title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When the Java Perspective is active, if a java file is opened by double-clicking on it, and then right-clicking on the java file and selecting 'Open With .. System Editor', nothing happens. The workbench should display a warning message informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue, or display an error message instructing the user to close all other files first. This behavior is believed to be a safety feature to prevent external editing while the file is already opened in the workbench.
EB: When the Java Perspective is active, if a java file is already opened, and the user right-clicks on the java file and selects 'Open With .. System Editor', the workbench should display a warning message informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue, or display an error message instructing the user to close all other files first.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double-click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files. 
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the java file. 
3. Select 'Open With .. System Editor'. 
4. Verify that no warning message or error message is displayed.
